article.headline: Old Dominion 88, Towson 62
article.story: NORFOLK, Va. (AP) -- John Waller scored 21 points and Isaiah Hunter added 16 on Saturday night to lead Old Dominion to an 88-62 victory over Towson. The Monarchs (12-7, 7-3 Colonial Athletic Association) led 43-29 at halftime and shot 60 percent in the second half. Towson, meanwhile, shot 33.3 percent for the game. The Tigers (6-13, 3-7) got as close as 12 when Andrius Petkunas made a layup early in the second half, but the Monarchs gradually extended their lead to as many as 31. Waller and Isaiah Hunter each scored five points during a 14-2 run to give the Monarchs a 28-19 lead with 4:34 left in the first half. Valdas Vasylius added 14 points for the Monarchs, who outrebounded Towson 42-35. Arnaud Dahi scored 12. Mike Green scored 23 to lead the Tigers, but Towson was 4-for-15 from behind the arc compared to 10-for-24 for the Monarchs. Petkunas added 12 points for the Tigers.
